title: BitcoinGirl.Club
author: BitcoinGirl.Club
content: I am thinking if a user put me into his ignore list but I send him a PM does he get it? It is not sure if this is the case with me but either the user did not receive my PM or he is not responding to my request. I need to be sure that the first one is not the reason.I admit sometimes I am stupid to understand the forum features.

comments.author: suchmoon
comments.body: There is an option to ignore PMs (separate from forum post "Ignore" feature) but AFAIK the sender would not be able to send the message to someone who is ignoring them, i.e. in your case you would have known if the user in question is ignoring your PMs.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;sa=pmprefs

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: The ignore user option[1] is only for posts based on its feature's description since there is an ignore pm feature too (mentioned above).[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;sa=ignprefs

comments.author: ibminer
comments.body: I believe you also receive an automated message back notifying you that you are on the person's ignore list.edit: Actually it is more of a notification that appears, which blocks the message from ever sending, not really an automated message.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: This forum does make it a little difficult to ignore people.  You have to not only ignore them, but also block them from your personal messages.  Even then, if they post on a thread that you're following you will still get an email notification (last time I checked).  It's pretty annoying.  In my opinion the forum should be doing a little more to keep people from having to interact with trolls.  I know my ignore list and personal message block list have grown massively since I started utilizing them and that helps a lot (I see 2 ignored users on this thread even) from keeping the nonsense out of your brain.  Would be great if you could outright block people here so that you never had to see they posted or even know they exist.

I haven't thought about this tone too if you can still send pms on forum users who are on your ignore place as I also wanted to know

I know, question will be, if you ignore that user, why you click on his post history?However, it is still a bug of the forum.For email notification, I think forum should have a new option, Don't receive email notification when users in your ignore list reply in your topic. Now notifications are for all users.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: BitcoinGirl.Club on July 23, 2022, 07:32:45 PMI am thinking if a user put me into his ignore list but I send him a PM does he get it? I just did a quick test, and yes; You would get a PM from a member you put on ignore, and so a user who ignored you would also get your personal message.They would also get an email notification of the message. This would mean, the ignore user option only blocks the user from your posts and not PMs.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: hd49728 on July 24, 2022, 03:22:51 AMEven if you add a member in your Ignore list, you will still see their username in a hidden post in your topic. That means the ignored user never totally disappear in your eyes.Correct, the administrator Theymos when making that ignore button only had the idea of ignoring a member's posts in a topic you are reading, and not to completely ignore the member or whipe them completely from your sight, it should be called an "ignore member's post" button, until the administrator changes how it works.If you ignore a member, you will see the member's name and a button to unignore the member below, for the meantime the administrator can replace the member's name that still shows with "ignored". So it will be like this: if you see a member's post that you have ignored, you won't see the username, but instead 'ignored' so you don't know who it is, and then the 'unignore' button below.

See: https://simplemachines.org/community/index.php?topic=470110.0The bolded part, although the above reference concerns SMF 2.0, is not something explicit on this forum.Quote<...>Receive personal messages from - Members may control who is allowed to send them private messages. It can be limited to members not on their ignore list, buddies and administrators, or only administrators.<...>See: https://wiki.simplemachines.org/smf/Personal_messagesThe above link references that the quoted part applies only to smf 2.0, but I’ve got a feeling that the information is either not correct (some of the features on the 2.0 list are actually present in this forum running on version 1.1.9), or perhaps some (but not all) of these said 2.0 features are accessible from 1.1.9 though a patch.
